javadoc:
Class that implements a hashtable with long keys and double values.
     Because this class uses array of primitives
     to store the information, it serializes very fast.  This implementation uses
     seperate chaining to resolve collisions.

     My local change of LongShortHashtable (SCP 4/13/00)

methods.javadoc: Default constructor creates a table with an initial default capacity.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Default constructor creates a table with an initial default capacity.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructor creates a table with an initial given capacity.  The capacity
 will be adjusted to the next highest prime in the PRIMES table.

methods.name: put
methods.comment:
Adds a key/value pair to the hashtable. If the key is already in the table,
 the old value is replaced with the new value.  If the hashtable is already
 full, the hashtable will attempt to approximately double in size
 (it will use a prime number), and all the current entries will
 be rehashed.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key to associate with the given value.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value to associate with the given key.

methods.name: get
methods.comment: Returns the value for the given key.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key whose associated value is to be returned.

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Removes a key from the hashtable

params.name: key
params.comment: key to be removed from the hashtable.

return.comment: true if key is found and removed, false otherwise.

methods.javadoc: Remove all entries from the hashtable.
methods.name: removeAll
methods.comment: Remove all entries from the hashtable.

methods.javadoc:
Return true if the given key is in the hashtable.
@param key the key whose presence in this map is to be tested.
methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Return true if the given key is in the hashtable.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key whose presence in this map is to be tested.

methods.javadoc: Return the number of key/value pairs stored in the hashtable.
methods.name: size
methods.comment: Return the number of key/value pairs stored in the hashtable.

methods.javadoc: Returns an array containing all the long keys.
methods.name: getKeys
methods.comment: Returns an array containing all the long keys.

methods.javadoc: Resizes the hashtable to allow more entries.
methods.name: grow
methods.comment: Resizes the hashtable to allow more entries.

name: LongDoubleHashtable
comment:
Class that implements a hashtable with long keys and double values.
     Because this class uses array of primitives
     to store the information, it serializes very fast.  This implementation uses
     seperate chaining to resolve collisions.

     My local change of LongShortHashtable (SCP 4/13/00)
